page.title: 18St. Mary's Church, Bridport.
page.content: Bridport's Parish Church of St. Mary in South Street is one of a Team Ministry embracing six churches. The rector is the Rev. Canon Edward Montague Youens, Rural Dean of Lyme Bay. There are three services every Sunday: Holy Communion at 8 a.m., Parish or Family Communion at 9.30 a.m and Evensong at 6.30 p.m. Sometimes there is Choral Matins or a Civic Service at 11.a.m. There is also Holy Communion on Tuesdays at 10.30 a.m. The Church was extensively restored and enlarged in 1860. Whilst most of the nave and the handsome three-storey embattled tower date from the Perpendicular period of the fifteenth century, in the transepts are some early English arches and lancet windows going back a further two centuries.
